verses.text: A prayer of Habakkuk the prophet upon Shigionoth.
O Lord, I have heard thy speech, and was afraid: O Lord, revive thy work in the midst of the years, in the midst of the years make known; in wrath remember mercy.

similars.text: O Lord, thou didst hearken unto my words when I said, Let there be a famine, that the pestilence of the sword might cease; and I know that thou wilt, even at this time, hearken unto my words, for thou saidst that: If this people repent I will spare them.
Let them now that fear the Lord say, that his mercy endureth for ever.

verses.text: God came from Teman, and the Holy One from mount Paran. Selah. His glory covered the heavens, and the earth was full of his praise.

similars.text: And he blessed him, and said, Blessed be Abram of the most high God, possessor of heaven and earth:

verses.text: And his brightness was as the light; he had horns coming out of his hand: and there was the hiding of his power.

similars.text: And he had in his right hand seven stars: and out of his mouth went a sharp twoedged sword: and his countenance was as the sun shineth in his strength.

verses.text: Before him went the pestilence, and burning coals went forth at his feet.

similars.text: Through the brightness before him were coals of fire kindled.
A fire goeth before him, and burneth up his enemies round about.
At the brightness that was before him his thick clouds passed, hail stones and coals of fire.
There went up a smoke out of his nostrils, and fire out of his mouth devoured: coals were kindled by it.
There went up a smoke out of his nostrils, and fire out of his mouth devoured: coals were kindled by it.
Can one go upon hot coals, and his feet not be burned?
Through the brightness before him were coals of fire kindled.
At the brightness that was before him his thick clouds passed, hail stones and coals of fire.
A fire goeth before him, and burneth up his enemies round about.
There went up a smoke out of his nostrils, and fire out of his mouth devoured: coals were kindled by it.
There went up a smoke out of his nostrils, and fire out of his mouth devoured: coals were kindled by it.

verses.text: He stood, and measured the earth: he beheld, and drove asunder the nations; and the everlasting mountains were scattered, the perpetual hills did bow: his ways are everlasting.

similars.text: Before the mountains were brought forth, or ever thou hadst formed the earth and the world, even from everlasting to everlasting, thou art God.

verses.text: I saw the tents of Cushan in affliction: and the curtains of the land of Midian did tremble.

similars.text: And it came to pass that I saw a mist of darkness on the face of the land of promise; and I saw lightnings, and I heard thunderings, and earthquakes, and all manner of tumultuous noises; and I saw the earth and the rocks, that they rent; and I saw mountains tumbling into pieces; and I saw the plains of the earth, that they were broken up; and I saw many cities that they were sunk; and I saw many that they were burned with fire; and I saw many that did tumble to the earth, because of the quaking thereof.

verses.text: Was the Lord displeased against the rivers? was thine anger against the rivers? was thy wrath against the sea, that thou didst ride upon thine horses and thy chariots of salvation?

similars.text: Therefore thus saith the Lord God; Behold, I am against thee, O Tyrus, and will cause many nations to come up against thee, as the sea causeth his waves to come up.
For I, the Lord, have decreed in mine anger many destructions upon the waters; yea, and especially upon these waters.

Therefore, is the anger of the Lord kindled against his people, and he hath stretched forth his hand against them, and hath smitten them; and the hills did tremble, and their carcasses were torn in the midst of the streets. For all this his anger is not turned away, but his hand is stretched out still.

Therefore is the anger of the Lord kindled against his people, and he hath stretched forth his hand against them, and hath smitten them: and the hills did tremble, and their carcases were torn in the midst of the streets. For all this his anger is not turned away, but his hand is stretched out still.

verses.text: Thy bow was made quite naked, according to the oaths of the tribes, even thy word. Selah. Thou didst cleave the earth with rivers.

similars.text: Thou didst cleave the fountain and the flood: thou driedst up mighty rivers.

verses.text: The mountains saw thee, and they trembled: the overflowing of the water passed by: the deep uttered his voice, and lifted up his hands on high.

similars.text: Yea, behold at his voice do the hills and the mountains tremble and quake.
Thou coveredst it with the deep as with a garment: the waters stood above the mountains.
The words of God, which he spake unto Moses at a time when Moses was caught up into an exceedingly high mountain,

And when they told it to Jotham, he went and stood in the top of mount Gerizim, and lifted up his voice, and cried, and said unto them, Hearken unto me, ye men of Shechem, that God may hearken unto you.

When he uttereth his voice, there is a multitude of waters in the heavens; and he causeth the vapours to ascend from the ends of the earth: he maketh lightnings with rain, and bringeth forth the wind out of his treasures.

When he uttereth his voice, there is a multitude of waters in the heavens, and he causeth the vapours to ascend from the ends of the earth; he maketh lightnings with rain, and bringeth forth the wind out of his treasures.
Praise him, ye heavens of heavens, and ye waters that be above the heavens.
The waters saw thee, O God, the waters saw thee; they were afraid: the depths also were troubled.
Though the waters thereof roar and be troubled, though the mountains shake with the swelling thereof. Selah.
Thou coveredst it with the deep as with a garment: the waters stood above the mountains.
I beheld the mountains, and, lo, they trembled, and all the hills moved lightly.

verses.text: The sun and moon stood still in their habitation: at the light of thine arrows they went, and at the shining of thy glittering spear.
Thou didst march through the land in indignation, thou didst thresh the heathen in anger.

similars.text: Yea, behold, the anger of the Lord is already kindled against you; behold, he hath cursed the land because of your iniquity.
How thou didst drive out the heathen with thy hand, and plantedst them; how thou didst afflict the people, and cast them out.
And the Lord rooted them out of their land in anger, and in wrath, and in great indignation, and cast them into another land, as it is this day.
The heathen raged, the kingdoms were moved: he uttered his voice, the earth melted.

Hearken, O ye people who profess my name, saith the Lord your God; for behold, mine anger is kindled against the rebellious, and they shall know mine arm and mine indignation, in the day of visitation and of wrath upon the nations.
Wilt thou be angry with us for ever? wilt thou draw out thine anger to all generations?
O Lord, wilt thou turn away thine anger, yea, thy fierce anger, and cause that this famine may cease in this land.
Then said the Lord, Doest thou well to be angry?
Pour out thy wrath upon the heathen that have not known thee, and upon the kingdoms that have not called upon thy name.

Remember, and forget not, how thou provokedst the Lord thy God to wrath in the wilderness: from the day that thou didst depart out of the land of Egypt, until ye came unto this place, ye have been rebellious against the Lord.

Therefore, is the anger of the Lord kindled against his people, and he hath stretched forth his hand against them, and hath smitten them; and the hills did tremble, and their carcasses were torn in the midst of the streets. For all this his anger is not turned away, but his hand is stretched out still.

And that the whole land thereof is brimstone, and salt, and burning, that it is not sown, nor beareth, nor any grass groweth therein, like the overthrow of Sodom, and Gomorrah, Admah, and Zeboim, which the Lord overthrew in his anger, and in his wrath:

Therefore thus saith the Lord God; Surely in the fire of my jealousy have I spoken against the residue of the heathen, and against all Idumea, which have appointed my land into their possession with the joy of all their heart, with despiteful minds, to cast it out for a prey.
Even all nations shall say, Wherefore hath the Lord done thus unto this land? what meaneth the heat of this great anger?
And the anger of the Lord was kindled against this land, to bring upon it all the curses that are written in this book:
Thou renewest thy witnesses against me, and increasest thine indignation upon me; changes and war are against me.

Forasmuch as I exalted thee out of the dust, and made thee prince over my people Israel; and thou hast walked in the way of Jeroboam, and hast made my people Israel to sin, to provoke me to anger with their sins;

Prophesy therefore concerning the land of Israel, and say unto the mountains, and to the hills, to the rivers, and to the valleys, Thus saith the Lord God; Behold, I have spoken in my jealousy and in my fury, because ye have borne the shame of the heathen:

And thou, even thyself, shalt discontinue from thine heritage that I gave thee; and I will cause thee to serve thine enemies in the land which thou knowest not: for ye have kindled a fire in mine anger, which shall burn for ever.
How thou didst drive out the heathen with thy hand, and plantedst them; how thou didst afflict the people, and cast them out.

verses.text: Thou wentest forth for the salvation of thy people, even for salvation with thine anointed; thou woundedst the head out of the house of the wicked, by discovering the foundation unto the neck. Selah.

similars.text: Salvation belongeth unto the Lord: thy blessing is upon thy people. Selah.

verses.text: Thou didst strike through with his staves the head of his villages: they came out as a whirlwind to scatter me: their rejoicing was as to devour the poor secretly.
Thou didst walk through the sea with thine horses, through the heap of great waters.

similars.text: For the horse of Pharaoh went in with his chariots and with his horsemen into the sea, and the Lord brought again the waters of the sea upon them; but the children of Israel went on dry land in the midst of the sea.
Thou didst blow with thy wind, the sea covered them: they sank as lead in the mighty waters.
Thou didst divide the sea by thy strength: thou brakest the heads of the dragons in the waters.
Thy rowers have brought thee into great waters: the east wind hath broken thee in the midst of the seas.
For thou hadst cast me into the deep, in the midst of the seas; and the floods compassed me about: all thy billows and thy waves passed over me.
Art thou not it which hath dried the sea, the waters of the great deep; that hath made the depths of the sea a way for the ransomed to pass over?

verses.text: When I heard, my belly trembled; my lips quivered at the voice: rottenness entered into my bones, and I trembled in myself, that I might rest in the day of trouble: when he cometh up unto the people, he will invade them with his troops.

similars.text: My bowels, my bowels! I am pained at my very heart; my heart maketh a noise in me; I cannot hold my peace, because thou hast heard, O my soul, the sound of the trumpet, the alarm of war.
Let a cry be heard from their houses, when thou shalt bring a troop suddenly upon them: for they have digged a pit to take me, and hid snares for my feet.

This day will I begin to put the dread of thee and the fear of thee upon the nations that are under the whole heaven, who shall hear report of thee, and shall tremble, and be in anguish because of thee.

verses.text: Although the fig tree shall not blossom, neither shall fruit be in the vines; the labour of the olive shall fail, and the fields shall yield no meat; the flock shall be cut off from the fold, and there shall be no herd in the stalls:

similars.text: I will surely consume them, saith the Lord: there shall be no grapes on the vine, nor figs on the fig tree, and the leaf shall fade; and the things that I have given them shall pass away from them.
Thou shalt not sow thy vineyard with divers seeds: lest the fruit of thy seed which thou hast sown, and the fruit of thy vineyard, be defiled.
But of the fruit of the tree which thou beholdest in the midst of the garden, God hath said--Ye shall not eat of it, neither shall ye touch it, lest ye die.
They shall build, and another shall not inherit it; they shall plant vineyards, and they shall eat the fruit thereof. Even so. Amen.
But of the fruit of the tree which is in the midst of the garden, God hath said, Ye shall not eat of it, neither shall ye touch it, lest ye die.

verses.text: Yet I will rejoice in the Lord, I will joy in the God of my salvation.

similars.text: And my soul shall be joyful in the Lord: it shall rejoice in his salvation.
Rejoice in the Lord alway: and again I say, Rejoice.
The king shall joy in thy strength, O Lord; and in thy salvation how greatly shall he rejoice!
Rejoice, O my heart, and cry unto the Lord, and say: O Lord, I will praise thee forever; yea, my soul will rejoice in thee, my God, and the rock of my salvation.
I will be glad and rejoice in thee: I will sing praise to thy name, O thou most High.
Behold, my soul abhorreth sin, and my heart delighteth in righteousness; and I will praise the holy name of my God.
But I have trusted in thy mercy; my heart shall rejoice in thy salvation.
My meditation of him shall be sweet: I will be glad in the Lord.
And my spirit hath rejoiced in God my Saviour.

I will greatly rejoice in the Lord, my soul shall be joyful in my God; for he hath clothed me with the garments of salvation, he hath covered me with the robe of righteousness, as a bridegroom decketh himself with ornaments, and as a bride adorneth herself with her jewels.
Therefore my heart is glad, and my glory rejoiceth: my flesh also shall rest in hope.
And it shall be said in that day, Lo, this is our God; we have waited for him, and he will save us: this is the Lord; we have waited for him, we will be glad and rejoice in his salvation.
Restore unto me the joy of thy salvation; and uphold me with thy free spirit.
The Lord thy God in the midst of thee is mighty; he will save, he will rejoice over thee with joy; he will rest in his love, he will joy over thee with singing.
Be glad in the Lord, and rejoice, ye righteous: and shout for joy, all ye that are upright in heart.
While I live will I praise the Lord: I will sing praises unto my God while I have any being.
I have longed for thy salvation, O Lord; and thy law is my delight.

But let him that glorieth glory in this, that he understandeth and knoweth me, that I am the Lord which exercise lovingkindness, judgment, and righteousness, in the earth: for in these things I delight, saith the Lord.
The glory of the Lord shall endure for ever: the Lord shall rejoice in his works.
O God, my heart is fixed; I will sing and give praise, even with my glory.
But let the righteous be glad; let them rejoice before God: yea, let them exceedingly rejoice.
That I may shew forth all thy praise in the gates of the daughter of Zion: I will rejoice in thy salvation.
I will praise the Lord according to his righteousness: and will sing praise to the name of the Lord most high.
This is the day which the Lord hath made; we will rejoice and be glad in it.
I will praise thee, O Lord my God, with all my heart: and I will glorify thy name for evermore.
Therefore I will look unto the Lord; I will wait for the God of my salvation: my God will hear me.
Behold, I, the Lord, am merciful and will bless them, and they shall enter into the joy of these things. Even so. Amen.
We will rejoice in thy salvation, and in the name of our God we will set up our banners: the Lord fulfil all thy petitions.
He shall pray unto God, and he will be favourable unto him: and he shall see his face with joy: for he will render unto man his righteousness.
But, behold, I, the Lord, will hasten the city in its time, and will crown the faithful with joy and with rejoicing.
Thus saith the Lord, Keep ye judgment, and do justice: for my salvation is near to come, and my righteousness to be revealed.

And behold, I say unto you that if ye do this ye shall always rejoice, and be filled with the love of God, and always retain a remission of your sins; and ye shall grow in the knowledge of the glory of him that created you, or in the knowledge of that which is just and true.
But be ye glad and rejoice for ever in that which I create: for, behold, I create Jerusalem a rejoicing, and her people a joy.
Let all those that seek thee rejoice and be glad in thee: and let such as love thy salvation say continually, Let God be magnified.
I will be glad and rejoice in thy mercy: for thou hast considered my trouble; thou hast known my soul in adversities;
Behold, God is my salvation; I will trust, and not be afraid: for the Lord Jehovah is my strength and my song; he also is become my salvation.
And my soul shall be joyful in the Lord: it shall rejoice in his salvation.
And my soul shall be joyful in the Lord: it shall rejoice in his salvation.

I will greatly rejoice in the Lord, my soul shall be joyful in my God; for he hath clothed me with the garments of salvation, he hath covered me with the robe of righteousness, as a bridegroom decketh himself with ornaments, and as a bride adorneth herself with her jewels.
And my spirit hath rejoiced in God my Saviour.
Rejoice, O my heart, and cry unto the Lord, and say: O Lord, I will praise thee forever; yea, my soul will rejoice in thee, my God, and the rock of my salvation.
But I have trusted in thy mercy; my heart shall rejoice in thy salvation.
Therefore I will look unto the Lord; I will wait for the God of my salvation: my God will hear me.
The king shall joy in thy strength, O Lord; and in thy salvation how greatly shall he rejoice!
Behold, God is my salvation; I will trust, and not be afraid; for the Lord Jehovah is my strength and my song; he also has become my salvation.
That I may shew forth all thy praise in the gates of the daughter of Zion: I will rejoice in thy salvation.
But, behold, I, the Lord, will hasten the city in its time, and will crown the faithful with joy and with rejoicing.
Then will I go unto the altar of God, unto God my exceeding joy: yea, upon the harp will I praise thee, O God my God.
I will be glad and rejoice in thee: I will sing praise to thy name, O thou most High.
Behold, God is my salvation; I will trust, and not be afraid: for the Lord Jehovah is my strength and my song; he also is become my salvation.
The Lord thy God in the midst of thee is mighty; he will save, he will rejoice over thee with joy; he will rest in his love, he will joy over thee with singing.
The Lord is my strength and my shield; my heart trusted in him, and I am helped: therefore my heart greatly rejoiceth; and with my song will I praise him.

verses.text: The Lord God is my strength, and he will make my feet like hinds' feet, and he will make me to walk upon mine high places. To the chief singer on my stringed instruments.

similars.text: He maketh my feet like hinds' feet: and setteth me upon my high places.
He maketh my feet like hinds' feet, and setteth me upon my high places.
The Lord is my strength and song, and he is become my salvation: he is my God, and I will prepare him an habitation; my father's God, and I will exalt him.
The Lord is my strength and song, and is become my salvation.
It is God that girdeth me with strength, and maketh my way perfect.
God is my strength and power: and he maketh my way perfect.
The Lord is my rock, and my fortress, and my deliverer; my God, my strength, in whom I will trust; my buckler, and the horn of my salvation, and my high tower.
I will love thee, O Lord, my strength.
Unto thee, O my strength, will I sing: for God is my defence, and the God of my mercy.
The Lord is my strength and my shield; my heart trusted in him, and I am helped: therefore my heart greatly rejoiceth; and with my song will I praise him.

But it came to pass that I prayed unto the Lord, saying: O Lord, according to my faith which is in thee, wilt thou deliver me from the hands of my brethren; yea, even give me strength that I may burst these bands with which I am bound.
Behold, God is my salvation; I will trust, and not be afraid: for the Lord Jehovah is my strength and my song; he also is become my salvation.
I will sing unto the Lord as long as I live: I will sing praise to my God while I have my being.
I will go in the strength of the Lord God: I will make mention of thy righteousness, even of thine only.
I will praise the Lord according to his righteousness: and will sing praise to the name of the Lord most high.
Behold, God is my salvation; I will trust, and not be afraid; for the Lord Jehovah is my strength and my song; he also has become my salvation.
I will sing unto the Lord, because he hath dealt bountifully with me.
He maketh my feet like hinds' feet, and setteth me upon my high places.
He maketh my feet like hinds' feet: and setteth me upon my high places.
The Lord is my strength and song, and he is become my salvation: he is my God, and I will prepare him an habitation; my father's God, and I will exalt him.
The Lord is my strength and song, and is become my salvation.
The Lord was ready to save me: therefore we will sing my songs to the stringed instruments all the days of our life in the house of the Lord.
God is my strength and power: and he maketh my way perfect.
